description: A NASA spacecraft knocked into an asteroid two years ago to test planetary defense. Now, a new mission will inspect the damage, with the goal of helping future asteroid deflection.
title: A European spacecraft launches to perform a crash scene investigation on an asteroid

description: Vice President Harris remembered the victims of the attack by planting a memorial tree at her residence at the Naval Observatory in Washington, D.C., while former President Trump visited a sacred site for Hasidic Jews in Queens, N.Y.
title: Harris and Trump marked 1 year since the Oct. 7 attacks with tributes to the victims

description: For Palestinian civilians caught in the middle of the ongoing conflict between Israeli forces and the Hamas militant group, the consequences have been unremittingly difficult, and deadly.
title: 'All this blood, all this death': Palestinians protest Israel war with no end in sight

description: Renowned soul and gospel singer Cissy Houston has died. She was part of a extraordinary musical family that included Dionne Warwick and her superstar daughter, Whitney Houston.
title: Gospel great Cissy Houston has died at the age of 91

description: Rumors, misinformation and lies about the federal government’s response to Hurricane Helene have run rampant since the storm made landfall, especially around FEMA funding.
title: Fact checking falsehoods about FEMA funding and Hurricane Helene

description: The  justices also left in place a Michigan state constitutional amendment that barred the use of public funds for private schools.
title: Supreme Court ducks cases involving everything from abortion to Elon Musk

description: Many film critics and comic book fans say they felt the sequel felt short of their expectations. Others argue that was the whole point all along.
title: Despite mixed reviews, 'Joker 2' is on track to be one of the biggest comic-book-film flops

description: The Hamas-led assault that killed 1,200 people triggered a devastating Israeli military response in Gaza. Now the war has engulfed Lebanon and threatens to bring Israel and Iran into direct conflict.
title: 1 year after Hamas attacked Israel, the conflict grows more dangerous than ever

description: As Halloween approaches, it's time to start thinking about costumes for the upcoming festivities. But first, NPR wants to hear about your favorite unique holiday traditions.
title: NPR wants to know: What are some of your Halloween traditions?

description: Today marks one year since Hamas ambushed Israel, which sparked the ongoing war in Gaza. Now we take a look at how people have been impacted. And, how the Middle East conflict impacts Michigan voters.
title: How a year of Israel-Hamas war disrupted lives. And, key factors for Michigan voters

description: On social media, people are spreading false rumors that FEMA has abandoned victims of Tropical Storm Helene for political reasons. The reality on the ground looks a lot less partisan.
title: Helene recovery is more political online than on the ground

description: Former President Donald Trump credited the "grace of God" for his survival of the assassination attempt in Butler, Pennsylvania on July 13 in his return to the site for a rally on Saturday.
title: Trump and his faithful followers return to Butler, Pa., to energize the flock

description: The Nobel Assembly said that their discovery is "proving to be fundamentally important for how organisms develop and function."
title: Nobel Prize in medicine honors two Americans for discovery of microRNA

description: Vigils are taking worldwide to commemorate the approximately 1,200 killed in the Hamas attacks a year ago. Protests are planned to demand a cease-fire to the war that has killed nearly 42,000 in Gaza.
title: Vigils and protests mark one year since Hamas attacks on Israel as fighting rages on

description: Corey Widmer says the experience has made him think more about how he can help others.
title: His car stalled and he was filled with dread. Then help came from all around

description: Vice President Harris needs to win back Michigan voters President Biden looked poised to lose. Donald Trump’s appeal remains strong here, but he’s not without his own struggles.
title: It’s a close race for Michigan. These factors could decide it for Harris or Trump

description: State lawmakers from both parties are expanding protections for patients burdened by medical debt.
title: Medical debt snares millions of people. States, red and blue are passing laws to help

description: Maryland's Montgomery County is building mixed-income apartments in which people who can afford to pay market rate allow other renters to pay less. Cities and states nationwide are taking up the idea.
title: One possible housing crisis solution?  A new kind of public housing for all income levels

description: Differences in how quickly each state’s counties can report this year’s election results may lead to another “blue shift” or “red mirage” on the presidential electoral map.
title: This year’s Electoral College map may show another ‘blue shift.’ Here’s why

description: At Kibbutz Be'eri, where Hamas-led militants killed more than 100 people last Oct. 7, residents are grieving, reburying their loved ones — and returning to live in their old homes.
title: The Israeli village grieving the biggest loss from Oct. 7, one year later

description: Alejandro Arcos was sworn in last Monday as mayor of Chilpancingo, the capital of Guerrero state, where Acapulco is located.
title: In Mexico, the mayor of a state capital has been killed less than 1 week after he took office

description: LeBron James and his son, Bronny, are the first father and son to play in any NBA game at the same time, let alone on the same team.
title: LeBron and Bronny James play together for first time in preseason game for the Lakers

description: Neither former President Donald Trump nor Vice President Harris have plans to fix the national debt, risking "an eventual fiscal crisis," a budget nonprofit group found in its analysis.
title: Trump's plan would add $4 trillion more to U.S. debt compared to Harris', analysis says
